require
.
<EOS>
""Is
<EOS>
this
the
purport
of
the
Earl
of
Salisbury
's
despatch
?
<EOS>
"
asked
Guy
Fawkes
.
<EOS>
The
lieutenant
nodded
.
<EOS>
"Let
<EOS>
me
look
at
it
,
"
continued
Fawkes
.
<EOS>
"
You
may
be
practising
upon
me
.
<EOS>
""Your
own
perfidious
nature
<EOS>
makes
you
suspicious
of
treachery
in
others
,
"
cried
the
lieutenant
.
<EOS>
"
Will
this
satisfy
you?"And
he
held
the
letter
towards
Guy
Fawkes
,
who
instantly
snatched
it
from
his
grasp
.
<EOS>
"What
ho
!
"
<EOS>
he
shouted
in
a
loud
voice
;
"
what
ho
!
"
<EOS>
and
the
guards
instantly
rushed
into
the
room
.
<EOS>
"
You
shall
learn
why
you
were
sent
away
.
<EOS>
Sir
William
Waad
has
offered
me
my
life
,
on
the
part
of
the
Earl
of
Salisbury
,
provided
I
will
accuse
certain
innocent

—
innocent
,
except
that
they
are
Catholics
—
of
being
leagued
with
me
in
my
design
.
<EOS>
Read
this
letter
,
and
see
whether
I
speak
not
the
truth
.
<EOS>
"And
<EOS>
he
threw
it
among
them
.
<EOS>
But
no
one
stirred
,
except
a
warder
,
who
,
picking
it
up
,
delivered
it
to
the
lieutenant
.
<EOS>
"You
will
now
understand
whom
you
have
to
deal
with
,
"
pursued
Fawkes
.
<EOS>
"I
<EOS>
do
,
"
replied
Waad
.
<EOS>
"
But
were
you
as
unyielding
as
the
walls
of
this
prison
,
I
would
shake
your
obduracy
.
<EOS>
""I
pray
you
not
to
delay
the
experiment
,
"
said
Fawkes
.
<EOS>
"Have
<EOS>
a
little
patience
,
"
retorted
Waad
.
<EOS>
"
I
will
not
balk
your
humour
,
depend
upon
it
.
<EOS>
"With
<EOS>
this
,
he
departed
,
and
repairing
to
his
lodgings
,
wrote
a
hasty
despatch
to
the
Earl
,
detailing
all
that
had
passed
,
and
requesting
a
warrant
for
the
torture
,
as
he
was
apprehensive
,
if
the
prisoner
expired
under
the
severe
application
that
would
be
necessary
to
force
the
truth
from
him
,
he
might
be
called
to
account
.
<EOS>
Two
hours
afterwards
the
messenger
returned
with
the
warrant
.
<EOS>
It
was
in
the
handwriting
of
the
King
,
and
contained
a
list
of

to
be
put
to
the
prisoner
,
concluding

"
to
use
the
gentler
torture
first
,
et
sic
per
gradus
ad
<EOS>
i
m
a
tenditur
.
<EOS>
And
so
God
speed
you
in
your
good
work!"Thus
armed
,
and
fearless
of
the
consequences
,
the
lieutenant
summoned
Jasper
Ipgreve
.
<EOS>
"We
have
a
very
refractory
prisoner
to
deal
with
,
"
he
said
,
as
the
jailer
appeared
.
<EOS>
"
But
I
have
just
received
the
royal
authority
to
put
him
through
all
the
degrees
of
torture
if
he
continues
